result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program after serving 24 Months of sentence.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 13 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
- No contact with Firearms and ammunition.
- No possession of drug paraph.
- Attend Treatment and counseling programs determined by agent.

- AODA assessment.
- Maintain Absolute sobriety.
- Random Urine Screens.

supervisions.notes:
- Pay DNA surcharge by 10-14-2025 or Civil Judgment. 
- Court waived all mandatory and non mandatory costs due to the inability to pay. 
- Pay Supervision fees as determined by the department of corrections.

- Defendant s a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm.
- Defendant advised he/she may not vote until his/her civil rights are restored.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven Jones

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Steven Jones in court, in custody.  
Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court for Steven Jones.  
Attorney Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

COUNT 1:  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT 
6 YEARS onsecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 13 days time served; 

The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; 
MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  3 YEARS. 

Defendant IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program after serving 24 Months of sentence.

 
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION.
Pay DNA surcharge by 10-14-2025  or Civil Judgment. 
Court waived all mandatory and non mandatory costs due to the inability to pay. 
 Pay Supervision fees as determined by the department of corrections. 
AODA assessment 
 Attend Treatment and counseling programs determined by agent.
Obtain/Maintain Employment or attend school.
Maintain Absolute sobriety.
Random Urine Screens 
NO Contact with Firearms and ammunition.
No possession of drug paraph
Defendant s a convicted felon he/she may never possess a firearm.
Defendant advised he/she may not vote until his/her civil rights are restored 
Appellate rights
per call from Dodge Correctional Institution defendant will be transferred to Criminal Justice Facility today on a Writ.

Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court, defendant Steven Jones not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Sentencing Hearing. Defendant not produced via Zoom. Court ordered case adjourned off the record. New date confirmed with parties in person.,
New date confirmed with Dodge Correctional Institution., Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Sentencing Memorandum Letter by Badger State Investigative Serivces, LLC

Defendant Steven Jones in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Steven Jones in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a Plea hearing. Court is in receipt of the State's Amended Information. Defense acknowledge reading and enters a not guilty plea. 
Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
Court is in receipt Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum.  Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.
 
PLEA HEARING PROCEEDED: 

AS TO COUNT 1:  
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.   
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  
Court found defendant guilty as charged in the ameded Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.


AS TO COUNT 2 and COUNT 3: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charges DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
 .  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court, defendant Steven Jones not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Jury Trial. Defendant in custody at Dodge Correctional Institution. Parties have reached a resolution.  Defense request a plea hearing.
Court ordered case adjourned for a Plea hearing -via zoom.  Case remains calendared in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Case calendared for 7-29-2022 at 1:30pm for expedited hearing in Branch 38. Court will be down as no reporter coverage available. Parties notified via email. Case remains set for August 1, 2022 at 8:30 am, Branch 45,

Court was notified by defense counsel requesting a plea heairng date. Court communicated with Branch 38 and scheduleda plea hearing date on Branch 38's calendar. Plea hearing scheduled for July 29th, 2022 at 1:30 pm before Branch 38.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights Form/ Addendum
Notice of Alibi; received and filed.

Defendant Steven Jones in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Steven Jones in custody.  William R. F. Ackell for Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Final Pretrial.  State and Defense prepared to proceed to Trial.  State made Offer.  Jury Trial to remain on calendar for August 1, 2022, at 8:30 am; assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.
Defense Proposed Jury Instructions.  Received and Filed.  nk
State's Witness List.  Received and Filed.  nk

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $5,000. Defendant is to reside with mother. Continued no contact.

Defendant Steven Jones in court with attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Defendant Steven Jones in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a bail bond hearing. Bail motion by defense argued and GRANTED by the Court. Final pre-trial scheduled fo June 29th, 2022 at 1:30 pm and jury trial scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 8:30 am. Case adjourned to Branch 45.

Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court, defendant Steven Jones not in court, in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested a bail bond hearing and final pre-trial and jury trial dates. DEFENSE ENTERED SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Speedy trial demand ends on August 11th, 2022. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Reduce Bail received and filed

Defendant Steven Jones in court with Attorney John Wasielewski on behalf of Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Stipulation to 19CF300 & 21CF4016 agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Slomczewski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed. Defense given a copy, waived reading and entered a plea of not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court, defendant Steven Jones not in court, in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is NOT present. State requests an adjournment. Defense objects and motions for dismissal. Court denied defendse motion and ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.

Court ordered no contact with SCG.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $7,500.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. Monitoring is 24 hour curfew.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Steven Jones in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant Steven Jones in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
